object.notes: This is basically those metal platforms around the Engine Room section of the Comet Observatory.

object.notes: This is the part up to the Engine Room, above the two cones that go into the energy sphere in the Comet Observatory.

object.name: Comet Observatory Change Stage Area (Cube)

field.name: Stage
field.values: 0 = Comet Observatory (In front of a dome), 1 = Gateway Galaxy, 2 = Comet Observatory, 3 = Library 4 = Comet Observatory, 5 = Dome

object.name: Observatory Decor B
object.notes: The red and blue rotating decoration by where you start/spawn on the Comet Observatory.

object.name: Observatory Dome
object.notes: This is basically all the outside models for the domes. obj_arg0 tells the game which dome to load.

field.name: Dome Number

object.name: Dome: Asteroids
object.notes: A cluster of asteroids that can be seen in the domes.

object.notes: The comet that appears in the domes.

object.name: Comet Observatory: Dome
object.notes: The entrances to the several domes in the Comet Observatory.

field.name: Dome

object.notes: A controller for the galaxy selection in the domes.

object.name: Dome Sky
object.notes: This object generates the sky for the domes.

field.name: Sky Variant
field.values: 1 = Variant A, 4 = Variant A, 2 = Variant B, 5 = Variant B, 3 = Variant C, 6 = Variant C

object.notes: An area that will fade out the music if entered. Re-entering the area will reset the music.

object.name: Big Amp
object.notes: A large electric amp that shocks Mario upon contact. Can be put on a path. Can be destroyed with the Invincibility power-up.

object.name: Big Bubble
object.notes:
A standalone version of the big bubble that is created by the BigBubbleGenerator object. The big bubble itself is invisible, but it can be used.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Big Bubble Camera Area (Cube)
object.notes:
A cube-shaped camera area for the big bubble.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

field.name: Exit Camera ID
field.notes: If this is set to -1, the camera area won't work!

object.name: Big Bubble Camera Area (Cylinder)
object.notes:
A cylinder-shaped camera area for big bubble.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

field.name: Exit Camera ID
field.notes: If this is set to -1, the camera area won't work!

object.name: Big Bubble Camera Area (Sphere)
object.notes:
A sphere-shaped camera area for the big bubble.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

field.name: Exit Camera ID
field.notes: If this is set to -1, the camera area won't work!

object.name: Big Bubble Generator
object.notes:
Infinitely generates new big bubbles of customizable size and shape at set intervals. Will only generate a new big bubble if there isn't one spawned on it already.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Pop Big Bubble Area (Cube)
object.notes:
A cubic area that pops any big bubbles inside it.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Pop Big Bubble Area (Cylinder)
object.notes:
A cylindrical area that pops any big bubbles inside it.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Pop Big Bubble Area (Sphere)
object.notes:
A spherical area that pops any big bubbles inside it.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Big Bubble Movement Limiter (Cylindrical)
object.notes:
Limits the movement of big bubbles inside the invisible cylinder.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Big Bubble Movement Limiter (Planar)
object.notes:
Limits the movement of big bubbles inside the invisible box.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Big Bubble Switch Area (Cube)
object.notes:
Cube-shaped area which activates the event that is assigned to its SW_A switch when the player enters it with a big bubble.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Big Bubble Switch Area (Cylinder)
object.notes:
Cylinder-shaped area which activates the event that is assigned to its SW_A switch when the player enters it with a big bubble.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

object.name: Big Bubble Switch Area (Sphere)
object.notes:
Sphere-shaped area which activates the event that is assigned to its SW_A switch when the player enters it with a big bubble.
The big bubble is the bubble the player can ride on and control around.

Plus, it requires ParticleData to function which is also lost. To conclude, this object completely useless, but it sure is interesting.

object.name: Group Switch Controller
object.notes: A controller that activates something via SW_A if all the connected switches are activated. The input value starts at the number defined in SW_B. (Example: If switch 44 should be activated, and there are four connected switches starting from 40, you set SW_A to 44, SW_B to 40 and obj_arg0 to 4.)

object.notes:
The lighter colored version of the Mushroom Twins wooden planets found in Honeyhive Galaxy.
* Not to be confused with the standard Mario power-up mushroom shape, this is not what these planets are, the "mushroom" shape is from a real life mushroom.

object.name: Honeyhive Mushroom Twin Planet (Dark Colored)
object.notes:
The darker colored version of the Mushroom Twins wooden planets found in Honeyhive Galaxy.
* Not to be confused with the standard Mario power-up mushroom shape, this is not what these planets are, the "mushroom" shape is from a real life mushroom.

field.values: -1 = Unknown, 0 = Spinning, 1 = Break-Dancing, 2 = Spinning, 3 = Sling Pod (Tarantox), 4 = Follow any collision directly below, 5 = Diving, 6 = Digging, 7 = Asleep, 8 = Jump out of Chest, 9 = Guard, 10 = Excited/Jumping, 11 = Scared, 12 = Happy, 13 = Running

field.name: Equipment
field.values: 1 = Snorkel, 2 = Pickaxe, 3 = Mailman Outfit, 4 = Spear and Shield, 5 = Glasses, 6 = Starbit, 7 = Toad Brigade Captain Outfit

object.name: Toad (Comet Observatory)
object.notes:
This is the object for the Toad NPCs on the Comet Observatory, for regular Toads used anywhere else, see the Kinopio object.
* May or may not require paths depending on which behavior (obj_arg2) is defined to it.

object.name: Bank Toad
object.notes: A special Toad that allows Mario/Luigi to store/withdraw his Star Bits.

object.name: Mail Toad
object.notes: A special Toad that delivers letters to Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Underwater Mine
object.notes: A stationary mine used in Deep Dark Galaxy.

object.notes: A moving mine used in both Deep Dark Galaxy (SMG1) and Cosmic Cove Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to function.)

object.name: Bowser (Bowser's Lava Lair)

* Collapses when hit by a meteor shot by Bowser/Bowser Jr. or other means.

object.name: Collapsible Bowser Stairs Big Platform
object.notes:
A bigger version of the collapsible* green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser's Star Reactor and Bowser's Galaxy Reactor.
* Collapses when hit by a meteor shot by Bowser/Bowser Jr. or other means.

object.name: Collapsible Bowser Stairs Turn Platform
object.notes:
A turning version of the collapsible* green and white platform that makes up the stairs in Bowser's Star Reactor.
* Collapses when hit by a meteor shot by Bowser/Bowser Jr. or other means.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Launch Star Platforms
object.notes: The set of platforms where the Launch Star to the Megahammer planet is found. Used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Asteroid Planet
object.notes: An asteroid-like planet seen in the background of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform
object.notes: A thin yellow moving platform used in Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. It requires paths. The following set of parameters is required: - GroupId same as parent's - SW_AWAKE must be equal to parent's SW_A switch - SW_B equal for both objects.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator Controller
object.notes: This object does additional controling of the platforms from Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. This object is connected to its parent KoopaJrLv2LiftGenerator object using the GroupId and GeneratorId (l_id of parent) settings. Additionally, this object requires paths.

object.name: Yellow Moving Platform Generator
object.notes: This object controls the generation of platforms from Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet. It requires a unique set of l_id, GroupId, SW_A and SW_B settings, as well as grouped KoopaJrLv2LiftForGenerator and KoopaJrLv2Lift objects. See their descriptions for more information.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Starting Platforms
object.notes: The set of platforms used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet: Checkpoint Platform
object.notes: A single platform used near the checkpoint of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Airship
object.notes: A standard airship with nothing special about it.

object.name: Megahammer
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of Bowser Jr.'s Fearsome Fleet.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Bowser Jr.'s Airship (Boss)
object.notes: A small airship controlled and tripulated by Bowser Jr. himself, which is the boss of Bowser Jr.'s Airship Armada.

object.name: Path-controlled Airship Platform
object.notes:
A small airship-styled platform that moves along an assigned path once activated by the player stepping on it.
Appears to use Path_args 1 and 2 for something.

object.name: Airship Platform Path Marker
object.notes:
A straight line of orange-ish dots that serve as a visual marker of the path the airship platform* takes on Bowser Jr.'s Airship Armada.
Extra notes: 1) This is entirely decoration, the airship platform* can still function perfectly fine without this object. 2) This object not dynamic, meaning you can change the real path taken by the airship platform*, by adding turns for example, and this object will still be a straight line, therefore entirely useless if you change anything on the real path, unless you remodel this object yourself.
* Reference to the KoopaJrSmallShipA object.

object.name: Bowser Jr. Statue

A cube-shaped area which controls the lighting when entered.

A cylinder-shaped area which controls the lighting when entered.

object.name: Deep Dark Watermelon Glass Cage Planet
object.notes:
A glass planet with 3 orange balls and a watermelon caged inside. Found in Deep Dark Galaxy.
Extra notes: The orange balls can be ground-pounded towards the watermelon* in the center to expand it, breaking the glass cage on the third and final hit, while also spawning a Power Star on the retail mission.
* The orange ball gets consumed when it hits the watermelon.

field.values: -1 = Light green, 0 = Green, 1 = Red, 2 = Yellow-ish green, 3 = Yellow 4 = Darker green

object.notes: A small disk-shaped planet containing fruit; used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Starting Planet (Before Transformation)
object.notes: The planet used as Starship Mario before it is transformed by Lubba.

object.name: Starship Flying Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A controller for the Starship taking-off cutscene.

object.name: Starship Mario: Chimney
object.notes: The chimney used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Rocket Booster
object.notes: A rocket booster used on the back of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: NPC Appear Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control when NPCs appear on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used as Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Ship Core
object.notes: The blue core used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Steering Wheel
object.notes: The steering wheel used on Starship Mario.

object.name: Player Cannon
object.notes: A cannon that the player can be launched out of.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Hammer Bros. Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the Hammer Bros. planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Cloud Ferris Wheel Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the cloud ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Cannon Target (Dark Matter Planet)
object.notes: A target for a cannon used on the dark matter planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: No Hat Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, causes Mario/Luigi to lose his cap.

object.name: Mecha-Bowser Wrecks: Left Arm (Non-Rotating)
object.notes: A non-rotating version of Mecha-Bowser's wrecked left arm. (Unused)

object.name: Mecha-Koopa
object.notes: A small robotic version of a Koopa that can be defeated by ground pounding it.

object.name: Bowser Cutscene Controller (Prologue)
object.notes: A controller used to trigger the Bowser cutscene in the prologue.

object.name: Lubba
object.notes: The large purple Luma that helps the player throughout their adventure in Super Mario Galaxy 2.

object.name: Flash Black: Mansion Door
object.notes: The door of the mansion used at the start of Flash-Black Galaxy. Use SW_A to close the door.

object.name: Flash Black: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Flash Black: Silver Star Platforms
object.notes: The planet where the Silver Stars are located in the first mission of Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Flash Black: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Flash Black Galaxy.

object.name: Skeeter
object.notes: A purple spider that lunges across water.

object.name: Li'l Cinder
object.notes: A small rock of fire that burns Mario/Luigi if he touches it; commonly called a "Burn Bit".

field.name: Spawn type
field.values: -1 = normal, 0 = spawns below position, then falls, 1 = spawns above position, then falls

object.name: Mercator Projection Area (Cube)
object.notes: Any object and its paths that are placed inside this area are projected around the origin of the zone. Only a limited amount of objects can be projected, objects that extend the classes MercatorFixParts, MercatorRailMoveParts and MercatorRotateParts are known to work with this. Note that the object OceanSmallTurtle requires mercator projection. This object is useless in SMG2. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: Message Area
object.notes: This area is used as a text trigger in various places.

field.name: Message ID
field.notes: Links to Unknown 5 in Nuntius novus.

object.name: Message Area (Cube)
object.notes: A cube-shaped area which triggers the linked message ID, regardless of not all conditions to trigger it by normal means being met. (May not work with all message types)

object.name: Message Area (Cylinder)
object.notes: A cylinder-shaped area which triggers the linked message ID, regardless of not all conditions to trigger it by normal means being met. (May not work with all message types)

object.name: Goombeetle
object.notes: A Goomba with a helmet on its head.

object.name: Decorative Meteor
object.notes:
A decorative meteor that drops a circular shadow under itself.
Not intended to be used within player reach due to weird collision.

object.name: Meteor (Gateway)
object.notes: A small meteor used in Gateway Galaxy. This will cause a quake once it hits the floor.

object.name: Meteor
object.notes: A meteor used in several galaxies, including Melty Molten Galaxy (SMG1) and Hightail Falls Galaxy (SMG2).

object.name: Space Junk: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Dome Warp: Galaxy Reactor
object.notes:
Unused, yet fully functional dome warp to the final galaxy of the main game, Bowser's Galaxy Reactor, which is normally accessed by talking to Rosalina after collecting enough Power Stars.
Extra notes: 1) Does not have any special model, re-uses the same Bowser head model as the other Bowser dome warps. 2) Needs to have obj_arg0 set to 2 (Boss) to have it's expected functionality.

object.name: Reflection Area
object.notes: Used for reflection models, but these don't exist in SMG2 anymore. Thus, this object is pretty much useless.

object.name: Peach's Castle (Low-poly Mirrored)
object.notes: A mirrored low-poly version of the Peach's Castle at the beginning of the game (SMG1)

object.name: Whittle
object.notes: A wood NPC who appears in Puzzle Plank Galaxy and Tall Trunk Galaxy.

field.name: Spawns Star
field.notes: Spawns a star if set to 0 and if AppearPowerStarObj is set up for a Whittle NPC. Seems to be hardcoded to work in BigTree2Galaxy only

object.name: Undergrunt
object.notes: A mole enemy with a helmet that moves on a path.

object.name: Pianta
object.notes: A Pianta used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

field.name: Color
field.values: -1 = light blue, 0 = light blue, 1 = light blue, 2 = yellow, 3 = orange, 4 = pink, 5 = green, 6 = purple, 7 = blue

object.name: Starshine Beach: Pianta Statue
object.notes: The large Pianta statue used in Starshine Beach Galaxy.

object.name: Large Moon Planet
object.notes:
A large moon planet with a bright half and a dark half, just like the real life moon.
Seen in Deep Dark Galaxy as a full moon on Kamella's battle entrance cutscene.

object.name: Starship Mario: Bee Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Bee Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Cloud Flower (Display Room)
object.notes: A Cloud Flower used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Spin Drill (Display Room)
object.notes: A Spin Drill used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Fire Flower (Display Room)
object.notes: A Fire Flower used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Spring Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Spring Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Rock Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Rock Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Starship Mario: Boo Mushroom (Display Room)
object.notes: A Boo Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.

object.name: Bee Mushroom
object.notes: A Bee Mushroom used to transform Mario/Luigi into a flying bee.

object.name: Fire Flower
object.notes: A Fire Flower allows Mario/Luigi to shoot fire balls.

object.name: Flying Star
object.notes: A Red Star that allows Mario/Luigi to fly (yes, FLY!) by shaking the Wii Remote.

object.name: Spring Mushroom
object.notes: A Spring Mushroom that allows Mario/Luigi to bounce into the air by pressing A with perfect timing.

object.name: Ice Flower
object.notes: An Ice Flower that allows Mario/Luigi to walk/skate on water.

object.name: Boo Mushroom
object.notes: A Boo Mushroom transforms Mario/Luigi into a Boo, allowing him to float in the air and go through certain walls.

object.name: Rock Mushroom
object.notes: A Rock Mushroom that transforms the player into a rock, allowing them to roll into walls and enemies.

field.name: Enable rolling permanent
field.notes: If set, Mario won't stop to rolling

object.name: Power-Up Switch Area
object.notes: Activates the switch that is assigned to its SW_A setting when the required condition is met.

field.name: Condition
field.values: 0 = Boo Mario, 1 = Rolling Rock Mario, 2 = Glowing Bulb Yoshi

field.name: Unknown 1
field.notes: No visible change ingame

object.name: Cutscene Video Player
object.notes: This is the player for THP videos. To use it, make sure to set Obj_arg0.

field.name: Video ID
field.values: 0 = Bowser attacks Mushroom Kingdom, 1 = Castle gets transported into space, 2 = Approaching the center of the universe, 3 = Black Hole, 4 = Epilogue

object.name: The Chimp's Gummit Challenge Room
object.notes: The planet where The Chimp is located in both Freezy Flake Galaxy and Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Invisible Platforms (Section A)
object.notes: The invisible platforms used on the first planet of Sweet Mystery Galaxy; appear when Yoshi eats a Bulb Berry.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Starting Planet
object.notes: A set of platforms used as the starting planet in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Comet Medal Platforms
object.notes: A set of platforms where the Comet Medal is located in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Background Food Objects (Donuts)
object.notes: A set of donuts used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Background Food Objects (Candy Canes)
object.notes: A set of candy canes used in the background of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Solid Platforms (Section A)
object.notes: A set of solid platforms used in the first section of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Invisible Platforms (Section B)
object.notes: A set of platforms used in the flipswitch panel section of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Soild Platforms (Section B)
object.notes: The solid platforms used in the flipswitch panel section of Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Gravity Changer Ramp
object.notes:
A small wooden ramp that changes the direction of the player's gravity when walked on. Used in some cubic bonus rooms in SMG1.
Note: Meant for use outside of any gravity area, otherwise may provide unexpected results.

object.name: Gravity Bonus Room
object.notes: A bonus room used in SMG1; used with the gravity room bridge to allow Mario/Luigi to walk across all walls.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Invisible Cake Planet
object.notes: An invisible cake that can lit-up with the Bulb Berry power-up; used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Solid Platforms (Cake Planet)
object.notes: The solid platforms used on the cake planet in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Straw Platform
object.notes: A platform made of straws; used on the cake planet in Sweet Mystery Galaxy.

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Present Box Platform (Red)
object.notes: A red present-box platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy. (This object requires a path to move.)

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Present Box Platform (Blue)
object.notes: A blue present-box platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy. (This object requires a path to move.)

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Present Box Platform (Yellow)
object.notes: A yellow present box platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy. (This object requires a path to move.)

object.name: Sweey Mystery: Invisible Chocolate Platform (Red)
object.notes: An invisible red chocolate platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy; can appear when Yoshi eats a Bulb Berry power-up. (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Invisible Chocolate Platform (Yellow)
object.notes: An invisible yellow chocolate platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy; can appear when Yoshi eats a Bulb Berry power-up. (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Sweet Mystery: Invisible Chocolate Platform (Brown)
object.notes: An invisible brown chocolate platform used in Sweet Mystery Galaxy; can appear when Yoshi eats a Bulb Berry power-up. (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Spiky Plant
object.notes: A spiky plant that damages Mario/Luigi if he touches it.

object.name: Spiky Plant (Flying)
object.notes: A spiky plant with a propellor for flying.

object.name: Spike Trap (Ground)
object.notes: A platform with spikes that pop out periodically.

object.name: Spike Trap (Wall)
object.notes: A wall with spikes that pop out periodically.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Bugaboom Planet
object.notes: The planet where Bugaboom is fought in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Starting Planet (Section A)
object.notes: The first section of the planet used at the start of Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Starting Planet (Section B)
object.notes: The second section of the planet used at the start of Stone Cyclone Galaxy.

object.name: Kleptoad
object.notes: A small blue enemy that likes stealing items; used in Hightail Falls Galaxy. Supported items include: Coins (Coin), Silver Stars (StrayTico), Star Chips (YellowChip/BlueChip), and Air Bubbles (AirBubble).

object.name: Hightail Falls: Kleptoad Planet
object.notes: The planet used in the secret Star mission of Hightail Falls Galaxy.

object.name: Koopa Troopa
object.notes: A standard version of a Koopa Troopa.

field.name: Color
field.notes: The color Blue is unused in the final game.

object.name: Big Koopa Troopa
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Koopa Troopa; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

field.name: Color
field.notes: The color "blue" is unused in the final game.

object.name: No Message Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, disables all message boxes.

object.name: No Sleep Area (SMG2)
object.notes:
IMPORTANT: SMG2 only. for SMG1, use NonSleepCube.
A cube-shaped area which prevents the player character from sleeping* while inside it.
* In both games, the player character will begin sleeping on the floor if left unpaused without any actions for a while.

object.name: No Sleep Area (SMG1)
object.notes:
IMPORTANT: SMG1 only. for SMG2, use NonSleepArea.
A cube-shaped area which prevents the player character from sleeping* while inside it.
* In both games, the player character will begin sleeping on the floor if left unpaused without any actions for a while.

object.name: Ending Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A controller that controls the ending cutscene.

object.name: Rainbow Notes
object.notes: An object which generates rainbow notes which can be collected. Requires SW_APPEAR and SW_A switches. If Obj_arg3 is set to 4, then a valid camera must be associated with the object, or the game will soft-lock.

field.name: Note spacing
field.notes: The spacing between notes

field.name: Fairy Speed
field.notes: How fast the Note Fairy moves (how fast the notes are generated)

field.name: Time
field.notes: The amount of seconds the notes are active for

field.name: Spawn Mode
field.notes: 4 = Use Appearance Cutscene

field.name: Song
field.values: -2 = Chromatic Scale, -1 = Chromatic Scale, 0 = Unused?, 1 = Unused?, 2 = Super Mario Bros. Underground Theme, 3 = Unused Placeholder Song, 4 = Super Mario Bros. Underwater Theme, 5 = Super Mario World Bonus Stage Theme

field.name: Play Completion Jingle
field.notes: Plays the "Task Complete" jingle when all the notes are collected

object.name: Snoodle
object.notes: A plant-like enemy with a green stem intended for underwater levels. Used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy and Slimy Spring Galaxy.

object.name: Water Bowl
object.notes: A bowl of water.

object.name: Buoy Base: Rotating Platform A
object.notes: A rotating platform used in Buoy Base Galaxy.

object.name: Buoy Base: Rotating Platform B
object.notes: A rotating platform used in Buoy Base Galaxy.

object.name: Buoy Base: Rotating Platform C (Unfinished)
object.notes: An unused and unfinished rotating platform which was meant to be used in Buoy Base Galaxy.

object.name: Buoy Base: Rotating Platform D
object.notes: A rotating platform used in Buoy Base Galaxy.

object.name: Melty Molten: J-Shaped Water Planet (Unused)
object.notes: A near-perfect copy of the planet from Melty Molten Galaxy, but with water instead of lava and different textures.

object.name: Water Sphere
object.notes: A sphere of water used in the background of underwater levels.

object.name: "Temporary High Model" Planet
object.notes: Yet another "Temporary High Model" object. See: https://tcrf.net/Super_Mario_Galaxy/Unused_Models#Placeholder_Planets

object.name: Throwback: Starting Planet
object.notes: The planet used at the start of Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Throwback: Rotating Plank Platform
object.notes: A rotating hexagonal-shaped platform used in Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Throwback: Wall Ledge Platform
object.notes: A platform that goes in and out of the walls in Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Throwback: Fortress Cover (Bowser Symbol)
object.notes: The cover used at the top of the starting planet in Throwback Galaxy; features a Bowser symbol.

object.name: Throwback: Fortress Cover (Plain Texture)
object.notes: The fortress cover used at the bottom of the starting planet in Throwback Galaxy; has no symbol on it.

object.name: Flipsville: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Flipsville Galaxy.

object.name: Tox Box
object.notes: A large stone box that rolls on its sides to follow an assigned path back and forth, crushing anything they roll on top of with any side other than the hollow one.

object.name: Beach Bowl: Cyclone Stone Planet (Section A)
object.notes: The first section of the planet used at the end of the third mission of Beach Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Beach Bowl: Wooden Triangle (Cyclone Stone Planet)
object.notes: A triangular-shaped piece of wood used on the cyclone stone planet in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Beach Bowl: Cyclone Stone Planet (Section B)
object.notes: The second section of the planet used at the end of the third mission of Beach Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Moving Stone Platform
object.notes: A rectangular-shaped stone block used on the cyclone stone planet (Beach Bowl Galaxy) (SMG1) and in Stone Cyclone Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Rotating Platforms (Long)
object.notes: A pair of long rotating platforms used on the cyclone stone planet (Beach Bowl Galaxy) (SMG1) and in Stone Cyclone Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Stone Cyclone: Rotating Platforms (Short)
object.notes: A set of three short rotating platforms used on the cyclone stone planet (Beach Bowl Galaxy) (SMG1) and in Stone Cyclone Galaxy (SMG2). (This object requires paths to move.)

object.name: Prologue Cutscene Controller
object.notes: A controller used to control the prologue cutscenes.

object.name: King Kaliente
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the third mission of Good Egg Galaxy.

object.name: King Kaliente's Planet (Duplicate)
object.notes: An almost identical copy of King Kaliente's planet used ingame.

object.name: King Kaliente's Planet
object.notes: The planet where King Kaliente is fought in Good Egg Galaxy.

object.name: Octopus
object.notes: A large Octoomba-like enemy that shoots coconuts and fire balls at Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Prince Pikante
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the first mission in Shiverburn Galaxy.

field.name: Unknown 0
field.notes: Possibly the boss bool?

object.name: Big Piranha Plant
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Piranha Plant; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: Piranha Plant
object.notes: A standard version of a plant that tries to eat Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Spiny Cages Planet
object.notes: The second planet used in the second mission of Yoshi-Star Galaxy.

object.name: Paragoomba
object.notes: A flying Goomba with wings. (This enemy requires paths to move)

object.name: Big Paragoomba
object.notes: A supermassive version of a Paragoomba; used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: Princess Peach
object.notes: The character in a pink dress that always gets kidnapped by Bowser.

object.name: Peach's Castle (Star Festival)
object.notes: Peach's Castle, as seen during the night of the Star Festival (prologue) in SMG1.

object.name: Meteor (Peach's Castle)
object.notes: A meteor used in the prologue at Peach's Castle.

object.name: Peach's Castle (Credits)
object.notes: A night-time version of Peach's Castle used in the credits.

object.name: Peach's Castle (Prologue)
object.notes: A day-time version of Peach's Castle used in the prologue; contains meteors from Bowser's attack.

object.name: Peach's Castle: Houses (Destroyed)
object.notes: A set of destroyed houses used during Bowser's attack on Peach's Castle in SMG1.

object.name: Peach's Castle: Houses
object.notes: A set of houses used at Peach's Castle in SMG1.

object.name: Peach's Castle: Town Gate
object.notes: The gate used in Peach's Castle used to block off the path behind the start of Peach's Castle.

object.name: Good Egg: Peanut Planet
object.notes: The peanut-shaped planet used in the first mission of Good Egg Galaxy.

object.name: Peanut Planet (E3)
object.notes: An early version of PeanutMudPlanet seen in the E3 Demo.

object.name: Penguin
object.notes: A sassy penguin.

field.name: Behavior
field.values: 0 = Sitting, 1 = Underwater (Breathing), 2 = Swimming, 3 = Jumping and Diving, 4 = Riding Shell, 5 = Normal, 6 = Walking

object.name: Coach Penguin
object.notes: The coach of the penguin class.

field.name: Mission
field.notes: SMG1 only

object.name: Penguru
object.notes: An elderly penguin character used in certain water levels.

object.name: Starbag
object.notes: A green bag-like enemy that turns invisible and runs away from Mario/Luigi; drops twenty Star Bits if defeated.

object.name: Bonus Planet Teleporter
object.notes: A teleporter that warps you to a bonus planet. The time spent on the bonus planet is defined by the obj_arg1 of this object.

object.name: Bonus Planet Teleporter (Exit Point)
object.notes: A spawn point used to define the location that the player warps to when returning from a bonus planet.

object.name: Bonus Planet (Grass)
object.notes: The grass planet used as a bonus planet.

object.name: Bonus Planet (Dirt)
object.notes: The dirt planet used as a bonus planet.

object.name: Bonus Planet Teleporter (Warp Point)
object.notes: A spawn point used to define the location that the player warps to when using a bonus planet teleporter.

object.name: Fizzlit
object.notes: A purple blop enemy that jumps around and creates a field of electricity from time to time.

object.name: Torch Fire (Red)
object.notes: A small red fire used on a torch.

field.name: Is decorative?
field.notes: Fire does not hurt the player.

object.name: Torch
object.notes: A small torch.

object.name: Ghostly: Decorative Wall Pieces
object.notes: A set of decorative wall pieces from Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Ghostly: Decorative Trees
object.notes: A set of decorative trees from Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Ghostly: Decorative Hole Planet
object.notes: A decorative planet with many holes in it, from Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Campfire Logs
object.notes: A set of logs used for a campfire site.

object.name: Ghostly: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Torch Fire (Blue)
object.notes: A small blue fire used on a torch.

field.name: Is decorative?
field.notes: Fire does not hurth the player.

object.name: Ghostly: Moving Stone Platform
object.notes: A moving stone platform used in the third mission of Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Jibberjay
object.notes: An orange bird used in the gliding galaxies.

object.name: Jibberjay (Race)
object.notes: An orange bird that triggers a race mission in gliding galaxies.

object.name: Ground Pound Stump (Small)
object.notes: A small tree stump that can be ground pounded.

object.name: Ground Pound Stump (Large)
object.notes: A large tree stump that can be ground pounded. It trigger the event that is linked to its SW_A.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Piece D)
object.notes: A piece of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Puzzle Plank: Mandibug Puzzle (Complete)
object.notes: The completed version of the Mandibug puzzle used in Puzzle Plank Galaxy.

object.name: Good Egg: Chomp Saucer Planet (Early)
object.notes: An early unused version of Good Egg Galaxy's Chomp Saucer Planet (DorayakiFortressPlanet), with a destroyed tower in the center.

object.name: Change Player Direction Area (Cube)
object.notes: An area that changes the direction the player is facing by 90 degrees as soon as entered.

object.name: Collision Area (SMG2 Duplicate)
object.notes: A SMG2-exclusive unused duplicate of PlaneCollisionCube. (May not be functional)

object.name: Collision Area (Cube)
object.notes: An area that creates invisible collision. This object ignores the AreaShapeNo setting.

object.name: 2D Restricted Area (SMG2)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, restricts movement to a 2D plane. (SMG2 variant)

object.name: 2D Restricted Area (SMG1)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, restricts movement to a 2D plane. (SMG1 variant)

object.name: Vine Sproutle

object.name: Plant A

object.name: Plant B
object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.notes: A more advanced flower spawner which uses ShapeModelNo for all the different flowers.

object.name: Vine Sproutle (Automatic Sliding)

object.name: The Chimp (NPC)
object.notes: A blue monkey used at the end of the first mission of Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

object.name: Restrict Power-Up Area
object.notes: Restricts the use of power-ups inside this area. If the player leaves the area, the effects of the collected power-up disappear.

object.name: Pole
object.notes: A standard climbable pole.

field.name: Controls
field.notes: Determines if the controls of the nunchuck while climbing the pole are inverted.

object.name: Pole (Two-Sided Climbing)
object.notes: An alternate version of the wooden pole which can be climbed on two sides only.

object.name: Pole (Invisible)

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Paintbrush (Blue)
object.notes: A large blue paintbrush used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece: Paintbrush (Yellow)
object.notes: A large yellow paintbrush used in Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy.

object.name: Pole (Square)

object.name: Pole (Square/Invisible)
object.notes: An invisible version of the square-shaped pole.

field.name: Controls
field.notes: Determines if the controls of the nunchuck while climbing the pole are inverted.

object.name: Round Tree
object.notes: A round tree used in Throwback Galaxy.

object.name: Pine Tree
object.notes: A pine tree used in Fluffy Bluff Galaxy.

object.name: Red Urchin Pole Planet (Unused)
object.notes: A strange rocky planet with a name referring to the fuzzy red Urchins found in hot galaxies. It has a low-poly model, but it is identical. Unlike the other unused planets, this one has an entire unused zone dedicated to it.

object.name: Bouldergeist
object.notes: The boss fought at the end of the third mission in Ghostly Galaxy.

field.name: Boss bool
field.notes: required for a proper boss setup

object.name: Bouldergeist Planet
object.notes: The planet where Bouldergeist is fought in Ghostly Galaxy.

object.name: Bouldergeist Planet: Platforms
object.notes: The stone platforms leading to the Bouldergeist planet.

object.name: Collision Bowl (Unused)
object.notes: An unused bowl-shaped collision object.

object.name: Collision Plate (Unused)
object.notes: An unused plate-shaped collision object.

object.name: Smeech
object.notes: A pink bug-like enemy that tries to suck on Yoshi, but runs away from Mario/Luigi.

object.name: Chance Cube (No Goomba)
object.notes: A dice block that can reward either a Star Bit or a 1-Up Mushroom.

object.name: Fog Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, creates a large fog effect. The color, radius and more can be configured with it's obj_args.

object.name: Outline Area
object.notes: This object draws an outline around models. Quite laggy, but it definitely looks cool.

object.name: Power Star Spawn Point
object.notes: A spawn point for a Power Star. The GroupId of this and the Power Star have to be the same.

object.name: Power Star Light
object.notes: The large light given off by a Power Star.

field.name: Set State
field.notes: Sets the state to HostTypeWaitScenarioOpeningEnd on actor initialization.

object.name: Rotating Metal Shields A
object.notes: A set of rotating metal shields that can be often seen to block a Power Star.

object.name: Rotating Metal Shields B
object.notes: A set of rotating metal shields that can be often seen to block a Power Star.

object.name: Rotating Metal Shields C
object.notes: A set of rotating metal shields that can be often seen to block a Power Star.

object.name: Before Final Bowser Cutscene Controller
object.notes: This object controls the cutscene before Mario/Luigi enters the final Bowser galaxy.

object.name: Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla: Fire Balls
object.notes: A set of fire balls used in the background of Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flotilla.

object.name: P-Switch
object.notes: A blue P-Switch that disappears and fires SW_A once stepped on.

object.name: Cheep Cheep
object.notes: A fish enemy used in underwater levels.

object.name: Deep Dark: Cheep Cheep Planet
object.notes: A small planet with a pool used in the second mission of Deep Dark Galaxy.

object.name: Cheep Cheep (Surface)
object.notes: A fish enemy that appears on the water's surface.

object.name: Return Area
object.notes: An area that, when entered, returns Mario/Luigi to the last platform they stood on.

object.name: Yoshi Star: Wooden Pull Block
object.notes: A large wooden block that can be pulled out of a wall using Yoshi's tongue.

object.name: Brick Block
object.notes: A standard brick block used in several Mario games.

field.name: Coins
field.notes: Number of coins. Is sequential except: -1 = 0, 0 = 1, 1 = 1

object.name: Brick Block (2D)
object.notes: A small brick block used in the prologue.

object.name: Stretch Plant
object.notes: A green plant that, when hit, stretches away from Mario/Luigi, then rebounds back to him.

object.name: Purple Coin
object.notes: A purple coin that spawns a Power Star once 100 of them are collected.

object.name: Purple Coin Switch Controller
object.notes: A controller that activates something through SW_A when 100 purple coins have been collected.

object.name: Purple Coin Spawner
object.notes: Once activated, spawns the purple coin UI and the purple coins in the area.

object.name: Purple Coin Line
object.notes: An object that creates a path of Purple Coins.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Push Wall (Gravity Planet)

object.name: Clockwork Ruins: Destroyed Push Wall (Gravity Planet)

object.name: Camera Shake Area (Cube)

object.name: Star Bunny

field.name: Behavior
field.values: 1 = idle, 2 = jumping and spinning, 3 = jumping along path

object.name: Race Path Setter
object.notes: An object used to set the path for the racing minigames Ray Surfing and Glide Race (NOT used on Cosmic Races)

object.name: Coin Line

object.name: Yoshi-Star: Moving Stone Planet

The storybook which Rosalina reads in the Library at the Comet Observatory as the player progresses through the game (SMG1).
Extra notes: This is not the object you're looking for if you want to edit the actual story told by Rosalina, whether it be the text or the images, it doesn't contain either of those, it's just a prop.

Rosalina in a sitting pose while holding her storybook*.
* The storybook is actually included within this object's model and is not the separate RosettaPictureBook object.

object.name: Galaxy Fly-In Controller
object.notes:
A controller used to control the fly-in path for each mission. NOTE: Time (Obj_arg0) is input in 100ths of a second. For example, if Obj_arg0 = 300 then the time is 3 seconds.
Camera Amount: In the Camera settings for the Galaxy/Zone, you may find e:Scenario starter:XXX:XXth (but in japanese). This is the Camera for this Scenario starter. (EXAMPLE: e:Scenario starter:001:00th would be for a Scenario starter with a Camera ID of 1) This number is determined by how many XXth's there are. (EXAMPLE: if [e:Scenario starter:001:00th,e:Scenario starter:001:01th,e:Scenario starter:001:02th] were camera's, you would put the number "3" as the value for Camera Amount.)

field.name: Time
field.notes: Time taken to complete fly-in.

field.name: Camera Amount
field.notes: Number of Cameras +1 (see notes)

field.name: Landing Rotation
field.notes: The speed of the player's rotation in the fly-in. (Can be negative)

object.name: Sky Station Star Select Controller (Prologue)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, loads the Star select screen for Sky Station Galaxy. (This object is used in the prologue.)

A hexagonal-shaped moving screw nut used on Dreadnought Galaxy.

object.name: Beat Block (Yellow)
object.notes: A yellow beat block.

object.name: Beat Controller
object.notes:
A controller that controls the beat. Used in several galaxies, including Beat Block Galaxy and Flash Black Galaxy.
The beat controls the way some objects behave, such as Beat Blocks.

object.name: Enemy Cannon
object.notes: A decorative cannon.

object.name: Sling Pod
object.notes:
A weird spiderweb-like object which Mario and certain NPCs (Toads) can attach to and then be launched in a straight line by pulling it with the star pointer holding A in the opposite direction of the desired launch and then releasing A. How far back you pull it also affects the speed and distance of the launch. There is no way to detach yourself or an NPC to it other than launching.
Extra Notes: If you are setting up a Tarantox battle, do not use this object, but it's special variant for Tarantox called SpiderAttachPoint.

object.name: Space Dust Effect (Large)
object.notes: A large space dust effect.

object.name: Space Dust Effect (Small)
object.notes: A small space dust effect.

object.name: Wood Debris A
object.notes: Debris of a destroyed ship as seen in Sand Spiral Galaxy.

object.name: Wood Debris B
object.notes: Wooden debris that can be found in the Honeyhive and Gold Leaf galaxies.

object.name: Mine
object.notes: A space mine that can be destroyed with a Star Bit.

object.name: Mine Path Marker (Line)
object.notes: A line marker for a mine.

object.name: Mine Path Marker (Circle)
object.notes: A circle marker for a mine.

object.name: Space Junk: Disk-shaped Rock
object.notes: A disk-shaped rock from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Space Junk: L-shaped Rock
object.notes: A L-shaped rock from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Dreadnought: Yellow Moving Platform
object.notes: A thick yellow moving platform from Dreadnought Galaxy. It was later reused in Shiverburn Galaxy.

object.name: Space Junk: Rock Stick A
object.notes: A long rock stick from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Space Junk: Rock Stick B
object.notes: Another long rock stick from the pullstar section in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Spherical Atmosphere
object.notes: A spherical atmosphere for planets.

object.name: Jr.'s Boom Bunker: Blue Rotating Platforms (Cloud Ferris Wheel Planet)
object.notes: A set of blue rotating platforms used on the cloud ferris wheel planet in Bowser Jr.'s Boom Bunker.

object.name: Spherical Bonus Room
object.notes: The spherical bonus room from Super Mario Galaxy.

object.name: Starball Boost
object.notes: An accelerator for starballs. (This object requires paths).

object.name: Tarantox Sling Pod
object.notes: A variation of the regular Sling Pod used on Tarantox's planet in Space Junk Galaxy. Behaves exactly the same way as the normal Sling Pod, the difference is probably internally to process hits on Tarantox or something along those lines.

object.name: Tarantox Web Coin
object.notes: A coin trapped in Tarantox's web. Touch it to release it from the web.

object.name: Tarantox Stone Block
object.notes: The destroyable stone blocks on Tarantox's planet in Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Cloud Platform (Cloud Flower)
object.notes: The cloud platform created by a Cloud Flower. Should not be placed in a galaxy!

object.name: Cloud Direction Controller Area
object.notes: This area controls and sets the direction of Cloud Flower platforms.

object.name: Cloud Flower
object.notes: A Cloud Flower that allows Mario/Luigi to create up to three cloud platforms.

object.name: Cloud Flower (Duplicate)
object.notes: A duplicate of the cloud flower object.

object.name: Sling Star
object.notes: A small star that slings the player from one place to another.

object.name: Supermassive: Pipe Planet
object.notes: The large green pipe planet used in Supermassive Galaxy.

object.name: Spin Tutorial Area (SMG2)
object.notes: An area that, when entered, tells the player how to spin.

field.name: Condition
field.values: -1 = normal, 0 = Cloud Mario, 1 = Boo Mario, 2 = Unknown -- but tutorial doesn't appear

object.name: Spin Tutorial Area (SMG1)
object.notes: Displays the tutorial on how to spin the Wii Remote on the bottom right corner of the screen when entered.

object.name: Blue Switch
object.notes: A small blue switch that triggers something. (This object requires an SW_A switch to function.)

object.name: Blue Switch (Force Animation)
object.notes: A somewhat complicated switch. Can activate something through SW_A and SW_B. SW_B is also used to make this object automatically deactivated when the same assigned switch gets turned on at another point in the galaxy.

object.name: Spinning Block
object.notes:
A colorful flat block (resembles Mario Kart item boxes) that slides around on the ground. Only seen on a single planet in Gold Leaf Galaxy.
Extra notes: They also have an Ice model used for an unused SMG1 Ice Flower ability, where if Ice Mario spins near an Octogoomba (possibly other enemies, untested) the enemy will be "frozen" into a fully functional SpinningBox using it's Ice model. This unused Ice Flower ability is extremely buggy and unpredictable, do not try to use it in your galaxies.

object.name: Spin Switch Controller Area
object.notes: A controller that acts as a switch. Activates it's SW_A when the player spins while inside it.

object.name: ?-Block (Splashing Coins)
object.notes: A block that drops some coins when hit.

object.name: ?-Block (Splashing Starbits)
object.notes: A block that drops some starbits when hit.

object.name: Water Spring (Effect)
object.notes: A water spring effect from Dreadnought Galaxy.

object.name: Comet (Credits)
object.notes: A comet used on the "The End" screen of the credits.

object.name: Starship Mario (Credits)
object.notes: Starship Mario as it appears in the credits.

object.notes: A cutscene controller for the credits.

object.name: Credits: Sky Model
object.notes: The sky model used in the credits.

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Splashing Effect (Center)
object.notes: The center part of a splashing effect from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.notes: The main planet used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Cove: Waterfall Splashing Effect
object.notes: An unused object that was once used in Cosmic Cove Galaxy. It creates the waterfall effects for the galaxy's main planet. This object is somewhat glitchy and in the final game, the splashes are part of the main model.

object.name: Good Egg: Level Select Model Part
object.notes: A small hemisphere planet bearing the name for Space Junk Galaxy. Despite this, it is featured in the level selection model for Good Egg Galaxy.

object.name: Space Junk: Rolling Crystal Planet
object.notes: The big rotating crystal planet from Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Question Mark Hill Planet (Unused)
object.notes: A strange planet with weird-shaped hills.

object.notes: A small stone platform from Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Space Junk: Small Stone Platform B
object.notes: Another small stone platform from Space Junk Galaxy.

object.name: Starship Mario: Star List Sign
object.notes: The sign used to show the Star List on Starship Mario.

object.name: Starman Fortress Planet
object.notes: A large fortress planet that has been scrapped during development.

object.name: Starbit
object.notes: A small piece of a Star; a snack enjoyed by Lumas everywhere.

field.name: Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = Silver

object.name: Starbit Crystal
object.notes: A large blue crystal that releases Star Bits when broken; used on Launch Star paths.

object.name: Breaking Starbit Cluster Effect
object.notes: A breaking Starbit cluster effect.

object.name: Starbit Crystal (Small)
object.notes: A small blue crystal that releases four Star Bits when broken; used on the Rock Mushroom route in Melty Monster Galaxy.

object.name: Starbit (Moving)
object.notes: This object creates star bits which move on a path.

field.name: Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = Silver

object.name: Starbit Flower
object.notes: A small flower that releases one Star Bit when touched.

object.name: Starbit (Following)
object.notes: Creates a bunch of star bits, that fly around the player. Should be used on launch star paths.

field.name: Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = Silver

object.name: Starbit Group
object.notes:
An object that either spawns a circle of starbits around itself or spawns starbits along a path assigned to it. If no path is assigned, the circle behavior will be used, otherwise, the path behavior will be used.
* Uses path_args 1 and 2 ? * Uses point_args 0 and 5 ?

field.name: Starbit amount
field.notes: The amount of starbits to evenly distribute along the path or circle.

field.name: Circle Radius
field.notes: The radius of the starbit circle, only used if a path is not assigned.

field.name: Starbit Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = Silver
field.notes: The color the spawned starbits will be.

object.name: Starbit Creator
object.notes: A rainbow-colored starbit which creates smaller starbits, when activated via SW_APPEAR. Providing a path is optional
object.sounds: SE_OJ_STAR_PIECE_MO_ST SE_OJ_STAR_PIECE_MO_ED SE_OJ_LV_STAR_PIECE_MO_MV SE_OJ_STAR_PIECE_BURST

field.name: Amount of starbits given after collecting
Color
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = Silver

field.notes: Inherited from the normal StarPiece object

object.notes: Spawns a lot of star bits when activated.

object.notes: Creates a bunch of star bits when activated.

object.notes: Mario will continue skating, even if he would normally fall down.

object.notes: An area that displays some text.

object.notes: An area that warps the player to a certain point.

object.notes: The sky model used in Beach Bowl Galaxy.

object.name: Deep Dark: Ghost Ship
object.notes: The ghost ship where Kamella is fought in Deep Dark Galaxy.

field.values: -1 = Coin, 0 = Nothing, 1 = 1-Up mushroom, 2 = Power Star, 3 = Starbits
field.notes: The Power Star requires a properly set up AppearPowerStarObj parameter

object.name: Sunlight Area (Cube)

object.name: Invisible Sunlight Area (Cube)
object.notes:
An area that applies "sunlight" effects to it's location. For instance, entering it as Boo Mario will remove the Boo powerup.
Does not have any visual effects or indicators.

object.name: Deep Dark Sunset Atmosphere
object.notes: A sunset atmosphere as seen in Deep Dark Galaxy.

object.name: Cosmic Spirit
object.notes: The dark blue Cosmic Spirit that aids the player if they die several consecutive times inside an area of a galaxy.

The second section of Bubble Breeze Galaxy to which the player goes after taking the Launch Star on the first section.

object.name: Chompworks: Uplift Platform
object.notes:
A blue platform that follows the assigned path when an SW_A matching it's SW_B gets activated and stops once it's deactivated. Has hardcoded(?) lava particles that display when rising and falling.
Advanced notes: - This object requires very specific timing to work correctly. Used in combination with a HipDropTimerSwitch (or another object that behaves like it), this object requires that the TimerSwitch object triggering it has an obj_arg0 (Time) of EXACTLY the amount of time it takes the platform to complete it's assigned path. - If the TimerSwitch time is longer than the time the platform runs its path, the platform will loop over it's path until the TimerSwitch time ends, which will then stop the platform ANYWHERE it is on the path when it happens, the platform will NOT fall back down or complete the path, it will simply stop where it is, even in the middle of the path. - If the TimerSwitch time is shorter than the time the platform runs its path, it will stop the platform anywhere on the path aswell, interrupting it from completing the path. When the platform is stuck mid-way through the path due to either scenario above, re-activating it will make it snap back to the beginning of the path to begin running through it, so the mid-way stops do not cause desyncs for where it stop between activations. - Requires specific path_args and point_args to work.

object.name: Chompworks: Sinking Platform
object.notes:
A single blue platform that sinks when Mario/Luigi stand on it. Used on the starting planet of Chompworks Galaxy.
[MapPart Arguments] MoveConditionType: Distance - How far it sinks (a negative value to make the object rising up will glitch, turning the object over instead will work) RotateSpeed: Sinking Speed - How fast it sinks RotateAngle: Return Speed - How fast it comes back to it's initial height

object.id: Credits of the SMG2: Project Template
object.notes:
Everything in this category are not objects but is my way of displaying this project's credits.
Aurum: Programmed a lot of the complicated SMG1 objects and everything from the original Assembly Pack.
Someone: Programmed a lot of the objects made at the start of this project, such as "CrystalSwitch", "SensorDetector", "JumpSwitchArea", "Jiraira".
Evanbowl: Programmed "CrystalSwitch", "PlayerSwitchCtrl", "CollectItemCtrl", "PowerStarSpawner", and made this object database!
Galaxy Master: Created the original Power Star Colors patch.
MTLenz: Testing.
Marionumber1: Created the original Power Up patches way back.
Zyphro: Power Star texture help.
And all thanks goes to Shibboleet. Syati has been such a fun tool to use, and the first tool to make custom code fun.

object.name: Power Star
object.notes:
A gold shiny Power Star that ends a mission when collected. The view from the Star Collect sequence can be changed in the rotation values.
SMG2 Project Template notes:
None of this will work unless you have the SMG2PT set up. Read the readme if you need help setting up.
There are new star types to use, you can use Whitehole's BCSV editor to use them!
"Red" A red power star, only used once ever in SMG1. "Blue" A blue power star, normally unused in both games. "Bronze" A bronze power star, normally only obtained by using the Cosmic Guide. "LegacyGreen" A green star that behaves like normal Power Stars.
Galaxy Banner fonts to come soon.
You can also remove the Power Star Chance BGM after a star spawn. Open up the BCSV editor:
/ObjectData/SystemDataTable.arc /SystemDataTable.arc/StarChanceExceptTable.bcsv
and add your galaxy in there.

field.name: Shadow Drop Distance
field.notes: How far the shadow drops down for

object.name: Power Star Spawner
object.notes:
An object that spawns a Power Star when it's SW_A is activated. Setting the "AppearPowerStarObj" in the galaxy's scenario data is not required.
Setting the same Group ID to the Power Star and Power Star Spawner will cause the Power Star to end it's appear path at Mario. Also adapts to gravity! Works really well with coin-collecting stars.
Started by Evanbowl, Aurum, and Someone Group ID support by Zyphro.

field.name: Power Star ID
field.notes: -1 defaults to Power Star ID 1

field.name: Delay after Activation
field.notes: Time in frames.

field.name: Use Mario's Position?
field.notes: If set to 0, the star starts it's spawn path at the player.

field.name: Use Sound Effect?
field.notes: If set to 0, a sound will be played when this object is activated. Requires an ActionSound entry.

field.name: Spawn Mode
field.notes: -1/0 = Normal Spawn, 1 = Normal, but no time stop, 2 = Appear Instantly, 3 = Slow Descend spawn

field.name: Y Height
field.notes: Distance in height used for if the Group ID is linked to a Power Star. Default is 300. Ignore if you do not plan to use the Group ID.

field.name: Use Display Model?
field.notes: Displays an intangible Power Star model where the Power Star Spawner is.

object.name: Bowser Land Mine
object.notes:
A large land mine with Bowser's emblem on the trigger. If the button is activated, it will charge for half a second and cause an explosion after that. This explosion affects any actor with Player, Enemy or MapObj sensors. If the actor is "killed", it will trigger the event that is attached to its SW_DEAD setting.
By Someone

field.name: Explosion Range
field.notes: Default is 500

object.name: Crystal Switch
object.notes:
A Zelda-like crystal switch that can be activated using Spin Attacks, Ground-Pounds, Star Bit Shots or by trampling on it. This will trigger the event attached to its SW_A setting permanently. However, if you specify the activation time, it will deactivate again after the set amount of frames have passed.
This object can be triggered by the Co-Star Luma.
By Someone, Evanbowl and Aurum
Our first real custom object with code, and the start of this project! Without the CrystalSwitch, this template would not have existed.

field.name: Event Time
field.notes: -1 = Infinite

field.name: Reusable?
field.notes: -1 = False, 0 = True

field.name: Use Timer Sound?
field.notes: -1 = False, 0 = True

object.name: Jump Switch Area
object.notes:
Activates SW_A when the player jumps.
Really fun when paired with Flip Panels or Flip-Out blocks.
By Someone

object.name: Invisible Action Switch
object.notes:
Activates the event that is attached to its SW_DEAD setting when it receives the specified sensor message. If that occurs, the actor will be "killed", causing it to be inactive.
Note that obj_arg0 is a list of SMG2's messages, or actions. Not all are documented, so try some values out! Provided in the template is all of SMG1's action message list, though just SMG1's actions. Things like Yoshi actions are not documented yet.
We used this a lot during testing. By Someone and Evanbowl

field.name: Rumble Wii Remote?
field.notes: 0 = True, 1 = False

object.name: Collectible Amount Controller
object.notes:
Activates the event that is attached to its SW_A setting if the required conditions are fulfilled. If the requirements are no longer met, the respective event is deactivated.
Activates SW_A when the check is successful.
If you are using this for a power star, using the "PowerStarSpawner", it's recommended you use "PowerStarAppearPoint" objects frequently.
Note that this object is a little complicated and will need some getting used to. By Aurum and Evanbowl.

field.name: Collectible Type
field.values: 0 = Coin, 1 = Purple Coin, 2 = Star Bits, 3 = Power Star

field.name: Operation
field.notes: 0 = Equal, 1 = Less Than, 2 = Less Than & Equal To, 3 = Greater Than, 4 = Greater Than & Equal To, 5 = Does Not Equal To

field.name: Switch Once?
field.notes: Deactivates the event when the check is no longer successful.

field.name: Clear Star Bits?
field.notes: Collectible Type must be set to 2 for this to work. Please use this with care in your levels, and do not abuse it.

object.name: Jump Guarder
object.notes:
A green Topman that generates Topmini if the player is near, however, it always remains stationary. Its head functions as a spring allowing the player to gain height when jumped on. SW_A and SW_B can be used to activate and deactivate the Topmini generation respectively.
By Aurum.

field.name: Coin Count
field.notes: used by MR::DeclareCoin. SMG1 only.

field.name: Topmini Launch Count
field.notes: Default is 4, value is clamped between 1 and 4

object.name: Ball Beamer
object.notes:
A mechanical enemy that emits circular shockwaves that damage the player. The shockwaves are meant to move along spherical gravity. If given a SW_A event, it will remain immobile until the specified event it active. SW_B can be used to destroy the Beamer permanently. If attacking, it will attempt to emit a new shockwave every 2 seconds.
SW_PARAM enables speed scaling using ParamScale. This can be used to slow down or speed up the object.
By Aurum.

field.name: Shockwave Speed
field.notes: Default is 12

field.name: Shockwave Life Span
field.notes: Default is 530

field.name: Use Shadow?
field.notes: Uses "JumpBeamerBeamShadow"

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: 0 = Red, 1 = Yellow

field.name: Activation Range
field.notes: Default is 3000

field.name: Number of Beams
field.notes: Default is 3, value is clamped between 1 and 12

object.name: Character Controller
object.notes:
A switch object that activates an SW_A event, depending on what character the player is playing as. Must be activated by an SW_B first.
By Evanbowl.

field.name: Character
field.notes: -1 = Mario, 0 = Luigi

field.name: Switch Type
field.notes: -1 = Activate, 0 = Deactivate

object.name: Sea Clam (Pull Star Chip)
object.notes:
A variant of the Sea Clams which holds a Pull Star Chip.
By Aurum.

object.name: Sea Clam (Purple Coin)
object.notes:
A variant of the Sea Clams which holds a Pull Star Chip.
By Aurum.

object.name: Autumn Leaves
object.notes:
A decorative pile of brown leaves that can be set to spawn an item when spinning in its range.
By Aurum.

object.name: Camera Shake Area (Cube)
object.notes: A cube-shaped area which shakes the camera once entered.

object.name: Launch Star
object.notes: A large green star that launches the player from one planet to another.

field.name: Flight Time
field.notes: How long Mario is flying until he's landing. In frames (60 = 1 second)

field.name: Shadow Drop Distance
field.notes: The distance to drop the shadow. In centimeters

field.name: Don't Grab Mario
field.notes: If set to true, the Launch Star won't grab Mario when he is nearby

field.name: Camera Amount
field.notes: Amount of cameras this Launch Star has inside the .bcam

field.name: No Appear Jingle
field.notes: If set to true, the usual Launch Star appearance jingle will not play

field.name: Landing Rotation
field.notes: Rotation the player lands at

field.name: Unknown 6
field.notes: Only used in Beach Bowl (SMG1)

field.name: SpinDriverPathDrawRange
field.notes: Used by a call to registerStorageSpinDriverPathDrawRange

object.name: Meteor Spawner
object.notes:
A spawn point used for meteors.
Warning: These will crash the game if they hit the ground. Designed for decoration only.

object.name: Sea Urchin (Shoal)
object.notes:
A purple Urchin with spikes on its body. It doesn't create any water splash particles when it moves.
By Aurum.

object.name: Giant Wood Windmill
object.notes:
Has 4 platforms. Seen on Honeyhive Galaxy.
By Someone.

field.name: Rotate Speed
field.notes: Multiplied by 1000, Default is 300.

object.name: Melty Molten: Lava Tide Planet (ScaleMapObj)
object.notes:
The planet used for the Secret Star mission in Melty Molten Galaxy.
Even though it's identified as a "ScaleMapObject", it should be placed through "Add Object > Normal". Then just set the obj_args and you should be good!
By Aurum.

field.name: Minimum Scale
field.notes: Multiplied by 1000, Default is 1000.

field.name: Maximum Scale
field.notes: Multiplied by 1000, Default is 1100.

field.name: Idle Time
field.notes: In Frames, Default is 120.

field.name: Scale Up Time
field.notes: Scale Up Time. Default is 240.

field.name: Scale Down Time
field.notes: Scale Down Time. Default is 240.

field.name: Initial Size
field.notes: 0 = Idle Small, 1 = Scale Up, 2 = Idle Big, 3 = Scale Down. Default is 0.

field.name: Repeat?
field.notes: Default is -1. If set to 0, the object will scale only once.

object.name: Switch Box
object.notes:
A cool looking block that activates it's SW_DEAD when destroyed.
This object can be triggered by the Co-Star Luma.
By Evanbowl.

field.name: Event Time
field.notes: -1 = Infinite

field.name: Respawn?
field.notes: -1 = False, 1 = True

field.name: Use Timer Sound?
field.notes: -1 = False, 1 = True

object.name: Swimming Gringill
object.notes:
A small Gringill that swims on a path. Can be defeated using Koopa Shells. If it dies, it drops a 10 Star Bits.
By Aurum.

field.name: Swimming Speed.
field.notes: Default is 20.

object.name: Cataquack
object.notes:
A blue duck creature from Super Mario Sunshine that catapults the player into the air.
By Aurum.

field.name: Launch Height
field.notes: Default is 1000.

field.name: Behavior?
field.notes: 0 = Walking, 1 = Sleeping, 2 = Walking, updates home position. Default is 0.

field.name: Can Drown?
field.notes: -1 = False, 0 = True

field.name: Small Binder?
field.notes: -1 = False, 0 = True

object.name: Wall Timer Switch
object.notes:
A switch to be placed on a wall. It can be activated using any of the player’s attacks. The event attached to SW_A will then be activated for the specified amount of frames. Can also slow time down.
By Aurum.

field.name: Event Time
field.notes: In Frames.

field.name: Force Jump?
field.notes: -1 = False, 0 = True

object.name: SwitchDice
object.notes:
A throwable dice with four red circles and two blue crosses on its sides. If it lands on a red circle, the event assigned to SW_A is activated, however, if it lands on a blue cross, SW_B is activated instead.
By Aurum.

object.name: Monty
object.notes:
A mole-like enemy that hides in a bunker. If the player enters its range, it will hop out, however, if the player is too close, it will retreat again. At the surface, it will try to throw a wrench at the player. It can be defeated by stunning it with a Ground Pound or by shooting a Star Bit at it and then performing a stomp or spin attack.
By Aurum.

object.name: Pokey
object.notes:
A cactus enemy that can be found in Good Egg Galaxy and Dusty Dunes Galaxy.
By Aurum.

field.name: Disable Item Drops?
field.notes: -1 = Disabled, 0 = Enabled

field.name: Use Vulnerable Phase?
field.notes: -1 = Disabled, 0 = Enabled

object.name: Flame Shooter
object.notes:
A red nozzle that shoots flames.
By Aurum.

object.name: WarpArea
object.notes:
Warps Mario to a General Position when entered. The position has to be named "WarpAreaDestPos000". The 000 corresponds to Obj_arg0.
Example: Obj_arg0 = 4 General Position Name = "WarpAreaDestPos004".
By Evanbowl with help from Aurum, AwesomeTMC, and Zyphro

field.name: Galaxy ID
field.notes: Obj_arg0 must be set to -1. This table is currently hardcoded, this will be changed.

field.name: Scenario ID
field.notes: Obj_arg0 must be set to -1.
